title: Pseudo-class
summary: In CSS, a pseudo-class selector targets elements depending on their state rather than on information from the document tree. For example, the selector a:visited applies styles only to links that the user has already followed.

parents.title: MDN Web Docs Glossary: Definitions of Web-related terms
